summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC officials (Janey, Hoecker, et al.) appealing a preliminary denial of his whistleblower award application. He alleges extensive SEC corruption, obstruction, and cover-ups to protect financial criminals involved in market manipulation, money laundering, and fraud schemes related to entities like Knight Capital (NITE/VIRT), Net Element (NETE), and others. He references his own TCRs (Tip, Complaint, or Referral) and hundreds of emails as evidence.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, appealing the SEC's preliminary denial of his whistleblower award application and alleging massive SEC corruption and obstruction to protect financial criminals.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: SEC recipient of Dilorio's emails, accused of failing to produce the record for his award determination and being part of the corrupt obstruction.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: SEC official (likely from the Office of the Whistleblower) repeatedly addressed in Dilorio's emails, accused of being part of the corruption and cover-up.

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.context: Referred to as 'Trump prolific Bag Man' and questioned about his relation to Michael Farkas in the context of Skyway and fundraising.

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.role: CEO of New Image Concepts/Blink Charging
persons.context: Described as CEO of a 'money laundering shell' and questioned about how he escaped a SkyWay SEC complaint. Linked to Milken/Drexel.

persons.name: Engel
persons.context: Referred to as a 'Milken/Drexel flunkie' on the Blink Charging (BLNK) Board of Directors.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Named in connection with Hanover/Magna and various shells (CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, FreeSeas, PRTH). Subject of an SEC complaint regarding bogus notes.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Detailed in Dilorio's 2013 TCR. Involved in World Trade Financial AML case, barred by FINRA as a 'Bad Actor' in 2013, and linked to Blink Charging in 2019.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Named defendant in an SEC 2018 complaint for pump-and-dump schemes, including promotion of Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Named defendant in an SEC 2018 complaint for pump-and-dump schemes, including promotion of Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: Clayton
persons.context: SEC Chair accused of not disclosing conflicts related to Sullivan & Cromwell, Jared Fishman, and NITE. Dilorio demands he step down.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Accused of playing a key role in keeping the 'criminal entity' NITE/VIRT operational. Linked to Chair Clayton.

persons.name: McKessy
persons.context: Named as an SEC official in possession of Dilorio's 2013 TCR.

persons.name: Crede
persons.context: Named in connection with money laundering/transaction laundering schemes involving Net Element, Milken, Putin, etc. Possibly a financier.

persons.name: Peizer
persons.context: Named in connection with fraud offerings (Esousa, Cobblestone) related to Net Element and Crede/Milken.

persons.name: Milken
persons.context: Repeatedly mentioned in connection with various fraud schemes, including Net Element, Crede, and Engel.

connections.description: Whistleblower corresponding with SEC official regarding the appeal of a preliminary denial of his award application, accusing her of obstruction.
Whistleblower corresponding with SEC official, accusing him of being part of corrupt obstruction and cover-ups.
Questioned about their relation in the context of alleged 'bag man' activities and Skyway.
Linked through Blink Charging (BLNK) Board of Directors; Engel described as a 'Milken/Drexel flunkie' on the board.
Both described as 'Bag Men' involved in similar schemes (Hanover/Magna, JMJ) and subjects of Dilorio's TCRs and regulatory actions.
Keener/JMJ involved in Blink Charging (fka New Image Concepts), a company where Michael Farkas is CEO.
Brothers and co-founders of SeeThruEquity, LLC, both defendants in an SEC pump-and-dump complaint.
SeeThruEquity issued pump-and-dump research updates on Net Element in April and August 2018, as cited in the SEC complaint.
Both associated with Sullivan & Cromwell; Fishman accused of playing a key role in keeping NITE/VIRT running.
Linked in connection with fraud offerings (Esousa, Cobblestone) related to Net Element.
Frequently mentioned together in the context of money laundering and fraud schemes involving Net Element.

events.title: Email Appeal to SEC
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sends emails to SEC officials (Janey, Hoecker, et al.) formally appealing the preliminary denial of his whistleblower award application related to Knight Capital.

events.title: Formal Appeal Summary Sent
events.description: Dilorio sent a summary email titled 'Formal appeal for preliminary denial covered action 2015-016 Knight Capital & Appendix' to SEC officials, summarizing hundreds of previous emails.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThruEquity
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint against SeeThruEquity, LLC, Ajay Tandon, and Amit Tandon for pump-and-dump schemes, including promotion of Net Element (NETE).

events.title: SeeThruEquity NETE Pump Update
events.description: SeeThruEquity issued a pump-and-dump research update on Net Element, Inc. (NETE).

events.title: SeeThruEquity NETE Pump Update
events.description: SeeThruEquity issued another pump-and-dump research update on Net Element, Inc. (NETE).

events.title: SEC Jaclin 'Shell Factory' Complaint
events.description: The SEC filed a complaint against Jaclin et al., detailing 'Shell factory' operations, including New Image Concepts (later Blink Charging).

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener/JMJ
events.description: FINRA barred Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' following an anti-money laundering case involving World Trade Financial.

events.title: Dilorio Files TCR with Berger
events.description: Christopher Dilorio filed his initial TCR (Tip, Complaint, or Referral) with SEC official Berger, detailing allegations against various entities.

keyFacts: Whistleblower Christopher Dilorio alleges the SEC is corruptly obstructing investigations and covering up massive frauds to protect financial criminals while denying him a rightful award.

Dilorio claims the SEC's preliminary denial of his award application is based on a fabricated record, as the SEC failed to produce the 'several hundred emails' he sent that should constitute the record.

The document details an alleged 'eco-system of fraud' involving entities like Knight Capital (NITE/VIRT), Net Element (NETE), Blink Charging, and individuals like Joshie Sason, Justin Keener, and the Tandon brothers (SeeThruEquity).

Dilorio asserts the SEC has used his information to bring some complaints (e.g., against Sason/NewLead, SeeThruEquity) but has obstructed others, allowing frauds like Net Element's money laundering to continue and even receive CARES Act funds.

Specific allegations include the SEC facilitating naked short selling via the DTCC's Obligation Warehouse (OW), enabling fraud offerings for Net Element, and Chair Clayton having undisclosed conflicts through Sullivan & Cromwell and Jared Fishman.
